channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024060150
item.description:
Report X-2024060150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-07T18:15:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS ON A PZ CART BEING MOVED AND FELL OFF LANDING ON TOP AND PRESSING TRIGGER ON FIRE EXTINGUISHER. LIQUID PUDDLE ON FLOOR. RESPONDED WEARING PROPER PPE AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO CLEAN UP AND PROCESS

item.title: Report X-2024051032
item.description:
Report X-2024051032

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-11
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PLASTIC BUCKET WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING WERE PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/ PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.
